candidates.title: Create a testing contract for easier "full stack" testing
`cosmwasm-check` multiple args
candidates.body:
Closes #1392

Test cases:

```
[tom@trilby cosmwasm]$ export GLOBIGNORE=artifacts/floaty.wasm
[tom@trilby cosmwasm]$ cargo run --bin cw-check-contract artifacts/*.wasm
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.05s
     Running `target/debug/cw-check-contract artifacts/burner.wasm artifacts/hackatom.wasm`
Available capabilities: {"staking", "stargate", "iterator"}

artifacts/burner.wasm: pass
artifacts/hackatom.wasm: pass

All 2 contracts passed checks!
[tom@trilby cosmwasm]$ echo $?
0
```

```
[tom@trilby cosmwasm]$ unset GLOBIGNORE
[tom@trilby cosmwasm]$ cargo run --bin cw-check-contract artifacts/*.wasm
    Finished dev [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.05s
     Running `target/debug/cw-check-contract artifacts/burner.wasm artifacts/floaty.wasm artifacts/hackatom.wasm`
Available capabilities: {"staking", "stargate", "iterator"}

artifacts/burner.wasm: pass
artifacts/floaty.wasm: failure
Error compiling Wasm: Could not compile: WebAssembly translation error: Error in middleware Gatekeeper: Float operator detected: F64Const { value: Ieee64(0) }. The use of floats is not supported.
artifacts/hackatom.wasm: pass

Passes: 2, failures: 1
[tom@trilby cosmwasm]$ echo $?
1
```

candidates.title: Add cw check contract to packages
candidates.body:
Updated changelog.
CI setup for cw-check-contract.

candidates.title: Bump k256
candidates.body:
[cosmrs 0.8 release](https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-rust/blob/main/cosmrs/CHANGELOG.md#080-2022-07-25]) bumped `k256`, which makes `cargo` unable to select compatible versions for `signature` dependency crate when building `cosmwasm-std` and `cosmrs` together.

This PR also bumps `k256`dependency with what should be minimal effect on `cosmwasm-crypto` [1] to remove the said incompatibility.

[1] k256 CHANGELOG: https://github.com/RustCrypto/elliptic-curves/blob/master/k256/CHANGELOG.md

candidates.title: Add query for the total supply of a coin
candidates.body:
currently it is not possible to query the total supply of a native SDK coin. this is something that protocols often need to do, especially that now contract are able to mint native coins thanks to the `tokenfactory` module. this PR adds the binding for this query type.

see also:
* https://github.com/CosmWasm/wasmvm/pull/337
* https://github.com/CosmWasm/wasmd/pull/903

candidates.title: More readable `Debug` formatting for `WasmMsg`
candidates.body:
Closes #1257 

If a `msg: Binary` field in `WasmMsg` can be decoded as string, it will be, exposing JSON data that's probably there. If decoding fails, it will fall back to the previous behavior of printing something like `Binary(00f3a8)`.

candidates.title: Update contracts to new schema gen standard
Better UX for defining query response types and schema generation
candidates.body:
The goal here is to remove the following schema generation boilerplate for contract authors:

```rust
        [
            ("verifier", schema_for!(VerifierResponse)),
            ("other_balance", schema_for!(AllBalanceResponse)),
            ("recurse", schema_for!(RecurseResponse)),
            ("get_int", schema_for!(IntResponse)),
        ]
        .into_iter()
        .collect()
```

And replace it with attributes added to the `QueryMsg` itself:
```rust
#[derive(QueryResponses)]
pub enum QueryMsg {
    #[returns(VerifierResponse)]
    Verifier {},
    #[returns(AllBalanceResponse)]
    OtherBalance { address: String },
    #[returns(RecurseResponse)]
    Recurse { depth: u32, work: u32 },
    #[returns(IntResponse)]
    GetInt {},
}
```

The drawback right now is that `cosmwasm_schema` is imported as a regular (not dev) dependency in the contract.

Does this bloat the wasm blob? **EDIT:** nope, the size of the artifact is the same either way! :ok_hand:

candidates.title: schema: introduce CosmWasm IDL
candidates.body:
Follow up from CosmWasm/cw-plus#722

Just trying to do the same thing, but "package it up a bit".

- [x] Do everything Ethan's PR does
- [x] Set up versioning of the format
- [x] Make it complete (all msg types)
- [x] Consider pulling msg variants out of the schema for easier processing in the future (not doing that unless it's requested/there's an obvious need)
- [x] Figure out how to tie query response types to query msg variants

candidates.title: Upgrade crossbeam-utils to 0.8.8 and crossbeam-deque to 0.8.1
Add ibc v3 support to message types
candidates.body:
Part of #1200 that is very close to me as I just worked on the ibcv3 integration in `wasmd`.

Added a new feature flag "ibcv3".

I made all effort to ensure the types are backwards compatible with ibcv1. With ibcv3 enabled:

The `ibc_connection_open` call may return a struct with a version field to set a custom version in handshake. (Previously it returned `()` which serialised to `null`, so they both can be safely parsed into `*MyStruct` / `Option<MyStruct>`)

`IbcPacketReceiveMsg`, `IbcPacketAckMsg`, and `IbcPacketTimeoutMsg` all require an additional relayer field from the runtime. Ibc v1 contracts will silently ignore this info if passed from the runtime.

Also updated the VM to handle this, and updated `ibc-reflect` contract to use ibcv3 (while `ibc-reflect-send` remains with "stargate" to ensure they both work)

@webmaster128 I would really like to get this into the 1.0 release if possible (along with your #1299 enhancement). It is just a type signature issue, so no major code/logic changes, but it will allow wasmd to to a lot more. (And implement ICA as a contract)

candidates.title: Implement panic handler
candidates.body:
Closes #1296

This shows how we can get the full panic information out of Wasm.

- [x] Implement
- [x] Create feature for compatibility
- [x] Call install_panic_handler automatically at the beginning of each entry point
- [x] Cleanup

candidates.title: Improve queue contract for iterator testing
Allow interface_version_7 in modern hosts
candidates.body: This PR is adapted from https://github.com/terra-money/cosmwasm/commit/8bd072cf1a006481d0e64f9415f367757f4b345e. The idea is to allow users to run interface_version_7 contracts in modern hosts. 🤞 this works for them.
